body_html:
Hi Gunan, Thanks so much for your reply. May i know which version of gcc was used when you compile the gpu version of tensorflow v1.2.0-rc2? Actually, for my case, the cpu version of tensorflow v1.2.0-rc2 could be compiled without any problem. Do you think this issue in gpu version is really caused by my gcc compiler? Is there any way that just change some minor parts of certain *.bzl or BUILD file rather than re-compile the whole source code of gcc? Thanks again for your help. Best regards Xin 2017-06-13 14:00 GMT-04:00 gunan <notifications@github.com>:
…
I too have sees this when building for CentOS. For me when I reinstalled gcc/g++ this was resolved. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#10665 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AKirbbIJ9hCw8h1gxnl_myasa0u_kuCzks5sDs5KgaJpZM4N37-3> .
body_text:
Hi Gunan,

Thanks so much for your reply. May i know which version of gcc was used
when you compile the gpu version of tensorflow v1.2.0-rc2?

Actually, for my case, the cpu version of tensorflow v1.2.0-rc2 could be
compiled without  any problem. Do you think this issue in gpu version is
really caused by my gcc compiler? Is there any way that just change some
minor parts of certain *.bzl or BUILD file rather than re-compile the whole
source code of gcc?

Thanks again for your help.
Best regards
Xin


2017-06-13 14:00 GMT-04:00 gunan <notifications@github.com>:
…
 I too have sees this when building for CentOS. For me when I reinstalled
 gcc/g++ this was resolved.

body:
Hi Gunan,

Thanks so much for your reply. May i know which version of gcc was used
when you compile the gpu version of tensorflow v1.2.0-rc2?

Actually, for my case, the cpu version of tensorflow v1.2.0-rc2 could be
compiled without  any problem. Do you think this issue in gpu version is
really caused by my gcc compiler? Is there any way that just change some
minor parts of certain *.bzl or BUILD file rather than re-compile the whole
source code of gcc?

Thanks again for your help.
Best regards
Xin


2017-06-13 14:00 GMT-04:00 gunan <notifications@github.com>:

> I too have sees this when building for CentOS. For me when I reinstalled
> gcc/g++ this was resolved.
